isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - REMOVE AND INSTALL - ACTUATOR, (FRESH/RECIRCULATE) AIR DOOR

svcprocinfo.para: Depending on the vehicle model/engine combination, replacement of certain components may require the removal of nearby assemblies (right splash panel, cab cowl tray, etc) to gain access to the components or mounting hardware. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

item.para: The cab cowl tray exists in several variations. Refer to the appropriate CAB Section in Group 16 of the Master Service Manual for procedures covering cowl drain trays.
For most other under hood assemblies that may require removal, refer to the appropriate section in GROUP 09 of the Master Service Manual.

note.para: Refer to Figure 23 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Disconnect wiring connector to actuator (1, Figure 23) for fresh/recirc air door.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Actuator for Fresh/Recirc Air Door

step1.para: Remove two screws securing actuator (1) to evaporator housing (2).

caution.para: In the following step, never force the actuator drive collar into position. If the drive collar position must be changed, perform the following procedures. Forcing the drive collar may result in a broken actuator.

step1.para: Install actuator by rotating door until flats on door shaft align with actuator drive collar, then carefully slip the actuator (1, Figure 23) onto end of door shaft so that mounting holes are properly aligned, if possible. If actuator drive collar must be moved to allow alignment:

step2.para: Place the actuator into its approximate position.
Connect a 9 Volt battery across pins A and F of the actuator connector, to rotate the drive collar. (Reverse the connection to rotate the drive collar in the opposite direction.)
Allow the drive collar to rotate until it is aligned with the door shaft, and the actuator mounting screws can be inserted. Then, disconnect battery.

step1.para: Secure actuator to evaporator housing (2) using two screws.
Connect wiring connector to actuator for fresh/recirc air door.

note.para: In the following step the actuator may also be recalibrated by disconnecting the vehicle battery for 15 seconds; however, this method may result in disrupting other electrical equipment (radio presets, etc.).

step1.para:
Recalibrate the fresh/recirc air door by disconnecting the HVAC control panel assembly for at least 15 seconds. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HVAC CONTROL PANEL ASSEMBLY
.
